title: Wal-Mart Gives Minimum Wage Workers A Raise
teaser: The retail giant will raise the minimum pay for half a million workers to at least $9 and hour in April and to $10 by February 2016.
contentencoded:
Wal-Mart, which has been heavily criticized for its low wages and working conditions, announced this morning that it will raise the minimum pay for half a million workers to at least $9 and hour in April and to $10 by February 2016.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson discusses the wage increaseÂ with Dan Bartlett, Wal-Mart’s executive vice president of corporate affairs.

Guest

  • Dan Bartlett, executive vice president of corporate affairs at Wal-Mart. He was also a counselor to the president in the Bush administration.
